name: NSTextContentStorage
desc: A concrete subclass of the text content manager that provides support for attributed strings that you use as a backing store.

items.name: func attributedString(for: NSTextElement) -> NSAttributedString?
items.desc: Returns a new attributed string for the text element.

items.name: func textElement(for: NSAttributedString) -> NSTextElement?
items.desc: Returns the text element corresponding to objectâ€™s attributed string.

items.name: var delegate: NSTextContentStorageDelegate?
items.desc: The delegate for the content storage object.

items.name: protocol NSTextContentStorageDelegate
items.desc: The optional methods that delegates of content storage objects implement to handle content processing.

items.name: func adjustedRange(from: NSTextRange, forEditingTextSelection: Bool) -> NSTextRange?
items.desc: Returns the text range, if any, in the backing store that required manual adjustment after editing.

items.name: func location(NSTextLocation, offsetBy: Int) -> NSTextLocation?
items.desc: Returns a new text location from an existing location and offset you provide.

items.name: func offset(from: NSTextLocation, to: NSTextLocation) -> Int
items.desc: Returns the offset between the two specified locations.
